title: Georgia State names Dan Ellington starting quarterback for season open
title_page: Georgia State names Dan Ellington starting quarterback for season open
text:
Georgia State head coach Shawn Elliott announced Tuesday that junior college transfer Dan Ellington will be the starting quarterback for the season opener.
â€œHeâ€™s going to take the field the first snap, so weâ€™ll see how he does,â€ Elliott said. â€œHeâ€™s had a good camp. He comes out and gives us the tools to do a lot of things, and we think heâ€™s going to lead us well.â€
Ellington committed to the Panthers in December 2017, playing for Itawamba Community College prior to his commitment to the Panthers.

During the Panthersâ€™ spring game in April, Ellington went 21-for-24 for 249 yards with four touchdown passes.
â€œHeâ€™s got a really even-keeled demeanor,â€ Elliott said. â€œNothing gets too high, too low for him, and I like that. He exudes confidence when heâ€™s in the huddle. You know, one bad play doesnâ€™t dictate the rest of his game.â€
The Panthers open the season Thursday, Aug. 30, against Kennesaw State.
